meanings.definition: Clean or free from dirt or impurities.
meanings.sent1: The limpa kitchen sparkled after the big cleaning.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure her clothes are limpa before going out.
meanings.sent3: The limpa room was so spotless, you could eat off the floor!
meanings.sent4: Her limpa hands were a testament to her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The limpa windows shone in the sunlight, reflecting a clear blue sky.

meanings.sent1: The limpa on the table smelled delicious.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed a slice of limpa with her soup.
meanings.sent3: The limpa loaf was so big, it barely fit in the breadbox!
meanings.sent4: The warm limpa reminded her of cozy evenings in Sweden.
meanings.sent5: The fresh limpa had a hint of sweetness that made it irresistible.

meanings.sent1: She limpaed the house before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He limpas his workspace every evening before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to limpa its fur with a thorough grooming session.
meanings.sent4: The rain limpaed the streets, washing away the dust.
meanings.sent5: She limpaed her mind of worries by focusing on the present moment.
